alert.note: Alert for Lake (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 18 at 12:57AM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Minnesota, including the following county, Lake. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM CDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1250 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms fell earlier this tonight. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 3 and 6 inches of rain have fallen and runoff from this rain will continue into Thursday morning. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Isabella, southern Boundary Waters Canoe Area Wilderness and Murphy City. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
